item.title: R-Downloads around the world
item.description: 1 Summary 2 Question 3 Dataset description 3.1 Total R Downloads 3.2 Total R Downloads per capita 3.3 Times of the year with most downloads 4 Linear regression - why use it? 5 Results 6 What does it mean? 1 Summary To see the code used in this post, visit my kernel on kaggle in R Markdown format. Write up 2 Question What countries download R the most?

item.title: Regression trees: predicting property prices
item.description: 1 Summary 2 Question 3 Dataset description 3.1 Missing values 3.2 Correlation 4 Regression trees - why use them? 4.1 Variable importance 5 Results 6 What does it mean? 1 Summary To see the code used in this post, visit my kernel on kaggle in R Markdown format. In this post I explore a property dataset from Ames, Iowa. The data describes a set of features for houses.

item.title: Exploring Kiva loans
item.description: 1 Summary 2 Purpose of this post 3 The data 4 Data cleaning 5 Exploratory data analysis 5.1 Borrower gender by region 5.2 Repayment interval by region 5.3 Loan use by region 6 Techniques used 7 Questions from this analysis 1 Summary To see the code used in this post, visit my kernel on kaggle in R Markdown format. In this post I analyse 671,205 Kiva loans from around the world.
